glosses: Used to form an adjectival or nominal meaning "that which belongs to."
Used to form an adjectival or nominal meaning "(the one) that is at/in."

examples.translation: I like the one on the right.

examples.text: Neden evdekini istiyorsun ki? Buradaki gayet iyi çalışıyor.
examples.translation: Why do you want the one at home? The one (that is) here works quite nicely.

glosses: added arbitrarily to words to make pseudo-Hellenisms
Form of -gi after the vowels E / İ.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish ـكی (-ki), from Old Anatolian Turkish ـكی (ki), ـكم (kim). Inherited from Proto-Turkic *-ki
